lines.text:
[Jim to his dad]
I'm getting a feeling that you want me out of your life.
I don't want you out of my life, I want you out of my house.
[On his first day as Target janitor (night cleanup boy) Jim Dodge meets the Custodian, who points a rifle at him]
Any little fraulein who expects anything more from me than a little bit of pleasure, a little bit of danger, and a great set of pectorals, she's lookin for a fall right on her ass.
Mr. McClellan, do you ever have any family problems, you and your daughter?
What the hell do you think this is?
You know, if my foot could talk...
...it would say, "May I please go up this geek's ass!"
And you're happy, you know, you're happy.
I'm not happy. I'm working nights, everybody thinks I'm a liar, my whole family's laughing at me... Reverend Harwell gave me the finger last week!
